name: The Beachouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week after 3.5 weeks bombing around New Zealand in a campervan, at the start of the Kiwi winter. The Beachouse was exactly what we needed - comfortable, thoroughly relaxing & really not at all like a hostel.
reviews.title: Really doesn't feel like a hostel at

likes.disliked: — Lack of hot water in the showers

reviews.text: The room we stayed in (one of the garden rooms) was massive, we had a huge double bed & 2 single beds. It was tastefully furnished & felt really luxurious after being crammed into a campervan for so long. The bathrooms are shared & were generally pretty clean. The hot water in the showers was fairly unreliable & I often ended up having a cold shower.
reviews.title: The Best Place EVER

likes.disliked: — the cockroaches - nothing you can do about it though - we were in Fiji

reviews.text: The pool area is great & the beachfront is next to it. It's great when the tide is in, but be warned that the tide goes out a long way so you'll only be able to snorkell & use the free kayaks at high tide. The 2 dogs that live there are the happiest dogs I've seen, and who can blame them, they're living the perfect lifestyle!
reviews.title: A very nice time!

reviews.text: The food is ok, not gourmet by any means & you can cook your own if you want to. Internet access is cheap & the staff are really helpful. The whole body fijian massages are a bargain at FJ$20 and must be had!
reviews.title: best holiday ever

reviews.text: The only difficulty we had was getting there. Email them & ask them if their driver can pick you up from the airport when he does one of his 2 daily runs, you can get a bus there but no one was able to tell us where to catch it from.
reviews.title: best place ever, really miss Jack!

likes.liked: — the wide range of travelers I met
likes.disliked: — my stay was not long enough!

reviews.title: Looking forward to returning there one day

likes.liked: — Staff, sea, views, new friendships while there.
likes.disliked: — Mildewy smell in common room, normal in tropical destinations that are not air conditioned.

reviews.text: My team mates and I stayed there for five days in September and absolutely loved the Beach House. We stayed in a garden room which had two single beds and a queen. Very clean and roomy for four adults.
reviews.title: A MUST go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From manicured gardens and daily raked beach to hearty, tasty meals, and beautiful beaches, this place is awesome. The staff is like none other, I miss them already and hope to see them again one day.
reviews.title: Amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We snorkeled, swam in the pool, got massages, hiked, explored, went to town, kayaked, ate the majority of our meals at the site, enjoyed the offered activities and had loads of time to just reeeeeeeelllllllaaaaax. Perfect.
reviews.title: Best budget place in Fiji
One of the best places I have stayed for the price!
reviews.text: I loved feeling right at home there and would highly recommend it to anyone. I assumed it would be mostly 20 somethings, but there were a number of well seasoned travelers of all ages, including a few with young children. All appeared to enjoy their stay.

description: The Beachouse is one of Fiji's finest budget resorts. It is located on Fiji's famous Coral Coast. Nestled in to 10 acres of pristine gardens with a private beach ... the Beachouse offers you a great Fiji atmosphere without blowing your budget!!The Beachouse caters to international backpacker/travellers as well as having 12 ensuite rooms for those that enjoy the relaxed atmosphere but also want some additional comfort and amenities. All prices include accommodation, light breakfast, afternoon tea, free wifi and use of sea kayaks. The resort has a cafe, bar & swimming pool plus much more.If you don't want to have fun .. don't come!! Hope to see you in Fiji!!
